sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A godly exhortation, by occasion of the late iudgement of God, shewed at Parris-garden, the thirteenth day of Ianvaris: where were assembled by estimation; aboue a thousand persons, whereof some were slaine; & of that number, at the least, as is crediblie reported, the thirde person maimed and hurt. Giuen to all estates for their instruction, concerning the keeping of the Sabbath Day. / by Iohn Field. Field, John.
[44] p. : ill.
Printed by Robert Walde-Graut, dwelling without Temple-barre, and Henry Carre in Paules Churchyard., At London; : 1583.
Dated at end: Ianuary. 17, 1583. Printer's device on t.p. (Mck. 227), headpieces, initials. Signatures: B-C⁸. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
=======
A godly exhortation, by occasion of the late iudgement of God, shewed at Parris-garden, the thirteenth day of Ianvaris: where were assembled by estimation; aboue a thousand persons, whereof some were slaine; & of that number, at the least, as is crediblie reported, the thirde person maimed and hurt. Giuen to all estates for their instruction, concerning the keeping of the Sabbath Day. / by Iohn Field. Field, John.
[44] p. : ill.
Printed by Robert Walde-Graut, dwelling without Temple-barre, and Henry Carre in Paules Churchyard., At London; : 1583.
Dated at end: Ianuary. 17, 1583. Printer's device on t.p. (Mck. 227), headpieces, initials. Signatures: B-C⁸. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
Robert Walde-Graut
Paules Churchyard.
Temple-barre
